channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-11545] ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown with "hadoop credential list -provider"
item.description:
Scenario:
========
Please run the following command . dn't give the provider path.

[hdfs@host194 bin]$ ./hadoop credential list -provider
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2
        at org.apache.hadoop.security.alias.CredentialShell.init(CredentialShell.java:117)
        at org.apache.hadoop.security.alias.CredentialShell.run(CredentialShell.java:63)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:70)
        at org.apache.hadoop.security.alias.CredentialShell.main(CredentialShell.java:427)
item.summary: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown with "hadoop credential list -provider"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Will give patch shortly....

Argument validation is not handled.

else if (args[i].equals("-provider")) {
        userSuppliedProvider = true;
        getConf().set(CredentialProviderFactory.CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_PATH, 
            args[++i]);

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12697074/HDFS-11545-001.patch
against trunk revision 1425e3d.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. There were no new javadoc warning messages.

+1 eclipse:eclipse. The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/5615//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/5615//console

This message is automatically generated.
ozawa can you please review this patch..?

+        if ((i+1) == args.length) {
+        printCredShellUsage();
+        return 0;
+        }
  • Would you please add indents?
  • We should return 1 since there is no argument for provider path.
-    public static final String USAGE = "list [-provider] [-help]";
+    public static final String USAGE = "list [-provider provider-path]";

Nice catch. Would you fix the USAGE of CreateCommand and DeleteCommand also?
In addition, I found hadoop credential create and hadoop credential delete commands cause ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. Would you fix them?
brahmareddy please address Akira's comment.

Hi ajisakaa

Thanks a lot for taking a look into this issue...I addressed all of your comments..can you please check once..

ozawa thanks to look into this issue..

This message is automatically generated.
Fixed the find bug issue...

Thanks for updating the patch. Some comments:

  • Would you return -1 in init()? You can fix it by changing the return type of checkArgs(int, int) to boolean, and checking the returned value in init().
  • I prefer checkArgs(int, String[]) to checkArgs(int, int) since the name of the method is to check the number of "arguments".
-    public static final String USAGE = "create <alias> [-provider] [-help]";
+    public static final String USAGE =
+        "create alias [-v value][-provider provider-path]";
  • alias should be <alias> because users don't type "create alias".

This message is automatically generated.
ajisakaa can you please review the latest patch..?
I can review it by the next Monday in PST time. Thanks brahmareddy for the update.

Thanks brahmareddy for updating the patch. Some comments are below.

+  private boolean checkArgs(int index, String[] args) {
+    if (index == args.length) {
+      printCredShellUsage();
+
+    }
+    return false;
+  }

1. The method always returns false, so init() does not return -1 if the length of args is wrong. I'm thinking it is sufficient to add the code into init() as follows:

if (i == args.length - 1) {
  printCredShellUsage();
  return -1;
}

-        "delete <alias> [-provider] [-f] [-help]";
+        "delete <alias> [-i][-provider provider-path]";

2. "-i" is not supported, so would you remove "-i" and keep "-f"?

-    public static final String USAGE = "create <alias> [-provider] [-help]";
+    public static final String USAGE =
+        "create <alias> [-v value][-provider provider-path]";

3. "-v" should be undocumented. The option is used only by test.
4. Would you add a test to confirm the return value of init() as specified by passing right/wrong arguments?

ajisakaa updated the patch based on your review comments..

-        "delete <alias> [-provider] [-f] [-help]";
+        "delete <alias> [-i][-provider provider-path]";

2. "-i" is not supported, so would you remove "-i" and keep "-f"?

-    public static final String USAGE = "create <alias> [-provider] [-help]";
+    public static final String USAGE =
+        "create <alias> [-v value][-provider provider-path]";

3. "-v" should be undocumented. The option is used only by test.

Above usage commands I got from documentation and placed here,,As you told these are used only for test. Thanks again for correcting me

will raise separate jira to undocument these options(-i from delete and -v from create)..

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks brahmareddy for updating the patch. Two comments:

+        if (i == args.length - 1) {
+          printCredShellUsage();
+          return -1;
+        }

1. Would you return 1 in init() instead of -1? Sorry for my mistake... Javadoc says

   * @return 0 if the argument(s) were recognized, 1 otherwise

+    assertEquals("Expected help argument on " + command + " to return -1", -1,
+        shell.run(command));

2. We should use init() instead of run().

Three minor nits:

+        "delete <alias> [-f][-provider provider-path]";

1. Would you add a whitespace between [-f] and [-provider provider-path]?

-import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
-import static org.junit.Assert.assertFalse;
-import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
+import static org.junit.Assert.*;

2. Would you keep the imports as is?
3. testcheckForEmptyArgforCommand() looks redundant. I'm thinking it's suficient to use testEmptyArgForCommands().

will raise separate jira to undocument these options(-i from delete and -v from create)..

Thanks. Would you please comment the issue number when you file a jira? (Creating a link to the jira would be better.)

Thanks ajisakaa for review comments..Attached updated patch..

Thanks. Would you please comment the issue number when you file a jira? (Creating a link to the jira would be better.)

Raised jira and linked to this issue..Issue num HADOOP-11609

Thanks brahmareddy for the update! One nit:

+    assertEquals("Expected help argument on " + command + " to return 1", 1,

"help" should be "empty". There are two places to fix. I'm +1 if that is fixed.
ajisakaa corrected the message,,please check updated patch...
